greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n*10^(n-1).
comment: This sequence gives the number of 1's (or any other digit) required to write all integers of n or fewer digits. It is thus A094798 for n=9, 99, 999, .... - Jason D. W. Taff (jtaff(AT)jburroughs.org), Dec 05 2004
reference: Albert H. Beiler, Recreations in the Theory of Numbers, Dover, N.Y., 1964, pp. 194-196.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100
Frank Ellermann, Illustration of binomial transforms.
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (20,-100).
formula: From Jason D. W. Taff (jtaff(AT)jburroughs.org), Dec 05 2004:  (Start)
program: (Sage) [n*10^(n-1) for n in (1..20)] # _G. C. Greubel_, May 16 2019
results.author: _Barry E. Williams_, Jan 15 2000
ext: Offset changed from 0 to 1 by _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jun 06 2011
